text: Meckenbeuren is a municipality in Bodensee in Baden-Württemberg in Germany. The current mayor of Meckenbeuren is Georg Schellinger since 2022. == Geography == === Location === Meckenbeuren is about north of Friedrichshafen and south of Ravensburg in the lower Schussental valley near Lake Constance. === Districts === The municipality of Meckenbeuren includes the core town of Obermeckenbeuren (since 1810). The former municipalities were incorporated in 1937 and current districts of Brochenzell and Liebenau (with the hamlets of Brugg, Hegenberg, Hirschach, Knellesberg, Langentrog, Schwarzenbach, Senglingen and Weiler, the farms of Berg, Buch, Furt, Hasenwinkel, Hohenreute, Holzbauer, Hungersberg, Kratzerach, Laufenen, Lohner, Madenreute, Mühlebach, Ottmarsreute, Rebholz, Regulator, Reuter, Sandgrub, Stengele, Straß, Untertennennenmoos and the houses Habacht). The village of Kehlen was incorporated in 1972 (with the villages of Kehlen and Reute, the hamlets of Buch, Gerbertshaus, Gunzenhaus, Holzreute, Lochbrücke, Sammletshofen, Sassen, Schürten, Schuppenwies, Sibratshaus and Siglishofen, the farms of Großbuch, Hechelfurt and Schindelhof as well as the houses Schübelbeer). == Main sights == * Ravensburger Spieleland, a 25 hectare amusement park in Liebenau * Humpismuseum (Humpis Museum) in the Humpisschloss (Humpis Castle) in Brochenzell * Schloss Liebenau (Liebenau Castle) === Gallery === Meckenbeuren Liebenau Ravensburger Spieleland Eingang.jpg|Ravensburger Spieleland (amusement park) Humpisschloss Brochenzell.jpg|Humpisschloss in Brochenzell Meckenbeuren Stiftung Liebenau Schloss.jpg|Schloss Liebenau (Liebenau Castle) == Twin towns == Meckenbeuren is twinned with: * Hohwald, Germany, since 1991 * Kehlen, Luxembourg, since 1993 == References == == Other websites == * Official website Category:Bodenseekreis
title: Meckenbeuren
